metadata.Title: CVE-2016-1254 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
Tor before 0.2.8.12 might allow remote attackers to cause a denial ofservice (client crash) via a crafted hidden service descriptor.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-1254` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

tor - 0.2.4.27-1ubuntu0.1
tor-geoipdb - 0.2.4.27-1ubuntu0.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: tor package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.2.4.27-1ubuntu0.1').
